import React, { Component } from 'react'; import '../App.css'; import { Card, CardDeck } from 'react-bootstrap'; import{ BrowserRouter, Link } from 'react-router-dom'; const CairnCare = () => { return (
Cairn Grooming

Hair cutting

I have gone into a professional groomer and had their haircut at home, especially make sure to make appointments with your groomer away before the holidays, as some book out for months around the holiday season. I have found that a hair cutting technic referred to as hand stripping allows the cairn to retain their wire hair-like texture and in doing so gives them a waterproof type layer of fur. Every cairn is a little different when it comes to getting a hair buzzed hair cut. I had my sire hair buzzer haircut when he was younger in age and his hair was very soft, but it is not as good at keeping him warm or waterproof. I never got my sire hair cut with hand strippers his hair now, after well over a year has become more wire type hair in some spots, despite only cutting with hair buzzers. My dams are all hand stripped, but I had one hair buzz one, one time when she was younger. It stunted her hair growth. That's the last time she got hair buzzed.

Nail Trimming

This is something I recommend for a groomer as well, but you will know your getting closer to the time to get nails cut when it has been a while and you can hear their nails tap on the floor. Cairns have nails that are black so you cant see

Shedding

I have found when the season changes from winter to summer that Cairns will shed quite a bit. Brushing their coat during the seasons changing can significantly reduce shedding, normally around once a week, hair brushing well helps a lot.

Positive Reinforcement Training

Positive Reinforcement Training or PRT I feel is the best and only way to train any breed, big or small. The overall concept behind it is only rewarding positive behavior and discouraging any negative or bad behavior. While training using the PRT method no physical abuse like slapping or hitting should ever be done or needed. PRT is more effective than any other training method I have found and will never require slapping hitting or shocking. Again this goes for cairns all the way up to mastiffs, you never need to hit a dog to teach it. When training, avoid using their main source of food as a reward or this can lead to food bowl aggression.

Vaccines & Medications

Do what your veterinarian recommends as certain vaccines are more crucial to have in different parts of the country than others. Certain parts of the country have different types of potential dangers. For example, some parts of the country have wood ticks others do not, some have more species of parasitic worms do to climate and winter temperature allowing, some parasites to live in thrive in some areas. Some gruesome facts about parasites like the heartworm are commonly transmitted from being on a mosquitoes mouth before the mosquitoes bits your puppy. I do not regularly treat mine for fleas or ticks and never had problems. When I will be traveling with them, they will be using shared pet relief areas, so I know I have to treat them for fleas and ticks, I know I do have them treated.

); } export default CairnCare;
